data.title: Patricia Donoho Hughes
data.text:
First Lady of Maryland

Patricia Donoho Hughes (August 18, 1930 â€“ January 20, 2010) was a First Lady of Maryland, married to former Maryland Governor Harry Hughes. She was educated at Sorbonne (1949) and Bryn Mawr College (1951).[2] She and Hughes eloped on February 7, 1950, and got a marriage licence in Prince George's county before officially getting married on June 30, 1951.[4][5] She later continued her education at the University of Delaware (1966).[2] Mrs. Hughes was a teacher and educator by profession.[2]

While serving as first lady in the 1980s, she worked to restore Government House, the governor's mansion.[6]

Family

[edit]

The Hughes family lived in Denton, Maryland, and have two daughters, Ann and Elizabeth.[2]

Death

[edit]

Hughes died on January 20, 2010, in Denton, aged 79, after 16 years of battling Parkinson's disease.[3]
